item.title: Rsgp buy
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

[quote=“Speljohan, post:37, topic:406262”][quote author=Greeny link=topic=503260.msg3690820#msg3690820 date=1312116277]
PKing can be botted but isn’t which is the only “fun” left in the game. Although the PVP in RS is hardly special.

I think the bots will continue and not even notice. Jagex will have to give in to it as the bots will make up most of the subscription base.
[/quote]Obviously we don’t have any numbers, but i think this speculation is false. There is a fuckton of people who actually PLAY, especially in the higher level brackets. I would be thoroughly surprised if more than 30% of the subscribers are bots.[/quote]

I’d be suprised if it was higher then ~5%. Though that ratio might be higher for players currently online, since bots can be left on all the time and most humans can’t. Which is the point

item.title: Rsgp buy
item.dc:creator: @the_bank the bank
item.description:
@the_bank wrote:

[quote=“Speljohan, post:37, topic:406262”][quote author=Greeny link=topic=503260.msg3690820#msg3690820 date=1312116277]
PKing can be botted but isn’t which is the only “fun” left in the game. Although the PVP in RS is hardly special.

I think the bots will continue and not even notice. Jagex will have to give in to it as the bots will make up most of the subscription base.
[/quote]Obviously we don’t have any numbers, but i think this speculation is false. There is a fuckton of people who actually PLAY, especially in the higher level brackets. I would be thoroughly surprised if more than 30% of the subscribers are bots.
This comes from someone who has been playing with high levels on members for quite some time. The only places you see bots are essence mining, flax picking etc. You don’t see them on higher level places because they’re usually banned very quickly.[/quote]I believe this is false. Like stated above, gold farming sites run tons of accounts over tons of worlds. How do you really know all those people in there aren’t botting? You have to look at the big picture, and not just wherever you are on whatever world.

T4_:

Because people in clans do not bot.

true story, source: fox news.

I dont know why they dont ban bots, the only incentive I can clearly see is for more profit. there are more botters paying subscriptions over and over again and not that many members leaving so for them from a business point of view they might as well leave it as the number of players leaving doesn’t cover the amount of players starting to bot and continue the memberships.

item.title: Rsgp buy

[quote=“Greeny, post:35, topic:406262”]PKing can be botted but isn’t which is the only “fun” left in the game. Although the PVP in RS is hardly special.

I think the bots will continue and not even notice. Jagex will have to give in to it as the bots will make up most of the subscription base.[/quote]Obviously we don’t have any numbers, but i think this speculation is false. There is a fuckton of people who actually PLAY, especially in the higher level brackets. I would be thoroughly surprised if more than 30% of the subscribers are bots.
This comes from someone who has been playing with high levels on members for quite some time. The only places you see bots are essence mining, flax picking etc. You don’t see them on higher level places because they’re usually banned very quickly.

item.title: Rsgp buy
item.dc:creator: @chrisn2323 chrisn2323
item.description:
@chrisn2323 wrote:

[quote=“Frell, post:27, topic:406262”][quote author=Budda link=topic=503260.msg3689247#msg3689247 date=1312017551]

as people have previously said playing rs is pretty pointless now, they are keeping it open and not stopping the bots because they are ~>60% of their monthly membership income…

I stopped playing a while ago and am waiting to sell my character and gold when the right buyer comes along

Actually no, they’re implementation of clans is a strategy that will ultimately defeat bots (they think). They’re taking the same approach as facebook, where its easy to remove accounts with 0 friends.

Almost everyone is going to be in a clan soon -every normal player. That throws most of the bots out in the open. They will examine how humans act in clans and start flagging people who act much different (but not banning them). Once they have figured out who is botting and who isn’t, they will throw up new detections without mentioning it, and mass ban bots.

Or they could let the bots defeat themselves by letting their game become overrun, and then doing an account wipe. Man id love for everyone to start over… itd be great.

Bot Clans.
[/quote]
Once compared to full human clans theyll be bannable. You see, once a player shows no social ties to the game, they can ban them without affecting a good portion of players.[/quote]
bot conversations.

Read full topic
